name: Vegan Strawberry Cake
description: This is the best Vegan Strawberry Cake ever! Made from scratch and bursting with fresh strawberry flavor. The frosting is to die for!
recipeIngredient: 1 pound fresh strawberries (1/2 cup reduced, see instructions)
3 cups cake flour (*or all purpose flour, cake flour is best)

itemListElement.text: Make the reduced strawberry puree: Rinse and hull the strawberries. Using a food processor or blender, puree them. Pour the puree into a small pot and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until it reduces to about 1/2 cup. You might have a little more than that; save for topping ice cream or waffles. Allow it to cool for a few minutes before adding to cake batter.
itemListElement.name: Make the reduced strawberry puree: Rinse and hull the strawberries. Using a food processor or blender, puree them. Pour the puree into a small pot and simmer for 25-30 minutes, until it reduces to about 1/2 cup. You might have a little more than that; save for topping ice cream or waffles. Allow it to cool for a few minutes before adding to cake batter.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and prepare 2 8-inch round cake pans by lining the bottom with a circle of parchment paper and spraying with oil.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and prepare 2 8-inch round cake pans by lining the bottom with a circle of parchment paper and spraying with oil.

itemListElement.text: Make the Vegan Buttermilk: Combine the non-dairy milk and apple cider vinegar. Stir a little, then set aside.
itemListElement.name: Make the Vegan Buttermilk: Combine the non-dairy milk and apple cider vinegar. Stir a little, then set aside.

itemListElement.text: Using an electric hand mixer or a stand mixer, cream together the softened butter, canola oil and sugar until creamy. Mix in the vanilla.
itemListElement.name: Using an electric hand mixer or a stand mixer, cream together the softened butter, canola oil and sugar until creamy. Mix in the vanilla.

itemListElement.text: In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.
itemListElement.name: In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt.

itemListElement.text: Using the mixer on low speed, alternate adding the flour mixture and vegan buttermilk to the bowl with the butter/oil/sugar mixture, mixing until just combined each time. Now add in the reduced strawberry puree with the mixer on low.
itemListElement.name: Using the mixer on low speed, alternate adding the flour mixture and vegan buttermilk to the bowl with the butter/oil/sugar mixture, mixing until just combined each time. Now add in the reduced strawberry puree with the mixer on low.

itemListElement.text: Pour the cake batter evenly into the prepared pans, and bake for 30-35 minutes, until the edges are golden brown, the surface looks and feels set and a toothpick inserted comes out mostly clean with no wet batter.
itemListElement.name: Pour the cake batter evenly into the prepared pans, and bake for 30-35 minutes, until the edges are golden brown, the surface looks and feels set and a toothpick inserted comes out mostly clean with no wet batter.

itemListElement.text: Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 15 minutes, then carefully invert them onto a cooling rack. Allow them to cool completely before frosting. You can place them in the refrigerator to speed the cooling process along if you need to.
itemListElement.name: Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 15 minutes, then carefully invert them onto a cooling rack. Allow them to cool completely before frosting. You can place them in the refrigerator to speed the cooling process along if you need to.

itemListElement.text: Using a food processor or blender, blend the freeze dried strawberries into a powder. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: Using a food processor or blender, blend the freeze dried strawberries into a powder. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Using your hand mixer or stand mixer, beat the vegan butter and shortening together until creamy. Gradually add the powdered sugar, 1/2 cup at a time, until all the powdered sugar is mixed in.
itemListElement.name: Using your hand mixer or stand mixer, beat the vegan butter and shortening together until creamy. Gradually add the powdered sugar, 1/2 cup at a time, until all the powdered sugar is mixed in.

itemListElement.text: Now add in the strawberry powder and mix in. With the mixer on low speed, add in the vanilla and 2-3 tablespoons of soy milk as needed to thin the frosting to a desirable consistency. If it gets too thin, add more powdered sugar. If it's too thick, add more milk until it's just right.
itemListElement.name: Now add in the strawberry powder and mix in. With the mixer on low speed, add in the vanilla and 2-3 tablespoons of soy milk as needed to thin the frosting to a desirable consistency. If it gets too thin, add more powdered sugar. If it's too thick, add more milk until it's just right.

itemListElement.text: Once the cakes are completely cooled, frost and enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Once the cakes are completely cooled, frost and enjoy!

keywords: vegan cakes, vegan strawberry cake, vegan strawberry desserts
